I don't know about you guys, but I really enjoyed this 2nd season.
Story: This season picks up right where the first left off, with the same style from the first season, which really helped this season. The build ups for the major battles were well done in my opinion, and really helped shape the characters. Although, I did find that the first half of this season was more of plot in order to kill off some people. That allowed the rest of the plot to advance so that conflicts would arise leading to the final battle in the end of this season. Now, onto thebattles. The battle between Archer 1 and Emiya was amazing, showcasing not only the quality animation from ufotable, but also the character's struggles and failed realisations. This really helped the characters, which was a bit lacking in the first season. But what really shines is the final battle, where Emiya not only becomes a badass, but he also comes to terms with his path in life. Overall, the story was much better in my opinion, but the first half could have been refined some more. Oh, one last thing. The only thing I'd like to have known, although stupid, is what Rin and Emiya had to miss in class due to this war. The thoughts seem stupid, but it's a genuine question of "How much class did they miss?".


Art: If you watched the first season, you'd already know how great the art was. For a deeper review on it, just read my review on Fate UBW S1. Anyways, the art in this season is basically the same, although now sporting some cleaner looks due to it being much newer, and probably with a higher budget. Art in battles are still great, and although shading is a bit lacking, the colors help make up for that. Art overall was an improvement.


Sound: Honestly, this category is the same as my season 1 review too, so I'll just summarise. Voice acting is still amazing, as always, and background music is really what sets the mood no matter where the characters are. The opening is still great, although I prefer the first one a bit more, but the ending is something that I personally liked more in this season.


Character: In the first season, the characters were pretty static, not really having much influence or change. But in this season, the characters all really come to life. Emiya is still an inexperienced kid who is fueled by a desire, but everything in between is filled in with this season. Without getting into spoilers, he finally does find out why he wants to continue his path of a hero of justice. Now, onto Rin. Rin is still your classic tsundere, but her ability to be rational and to give Emiya the straight answer is what sets apart her personality from the first season. No longer is she focused on an alliance that was to be broken off after Caster was defeated, but now this alliance has changed to something that doesn't want to be broken. Rin changes tp a character that I can like even more with the developments from this season. The last character I'd like to talk about before this section gets too long is Archer. I can't say his name without getting into spoilers, but Archer's ideals are and were the exact same as Emiya's. Now, Archer is still a supporting character, so he doesn't go through any actual change. However, Archer provides Emiya with the vital question that asks him why he wants to be a hero of justice. He then goes onto tell Emiya about what happens to people who try to live like how he envisioned, and I found this to really make Emiya more enjoyable, but also Archer, as you now can find out what Archer's "regrets" are.


Enjoyment: Making this simple, I really enjoyed UBW. 


Overall: UBW itself did have some problems, but they were minor in my opinion. I felt as if this was a solid series, and every episode had something in store. Hell, even the epilogue had something in store, hinting at something that could very well be a sequel with future Emiya. My thoughts on this show make me question why some people hate this season, but hey, that's what I get for enjoying everything. If you remove the hype that was with this show, like I did, you can watch this without the high expectation that the community gave, and use whatever expectation you had. To wrap things up, UBW was really good, and I feel that it's one of my favourite series now.

Okay, I'm not going to lie, I got really jaded of this story by the time I got to this second season of UBW. However, when that plot twist hit (which I will not reveal so that I can keep this spoiler free), my interest immediately peaked again.
As someone who watched the original 2006 Fate/stay night anime, I was sort of biased and predispositioned to prefer the chain of events in the Fate route. Although, I really enjoyed the ending of this anime overall, especially when I started making my own theories about how everything fit together. In fact, I liked it so much thatmy rating bumped from a 6 to a 9. Also, getting to know Archer in place of Saber in this route as opposed to the Fate route was very, very nice.


I mean, I don't know what else to say. I gave a pretty in depth review about my feelings regarding the Fate route vs. the UBW route on the UBW season 1 page, so go check that out if you want to know my thoughts. 


I guess I'm going to close this out by saying... No offense, Rin, but Saber and Shirou will always be my main Fate/stay night OTP. Fight me.

Most Anime that do a series split are often annoying and anti-climactic. You can tell when they want to have a proper intermission and when they just want to milk a show to death by cutting it half. "Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works" is not one of those shows. 
Okay, maybe they DO want to milk the franchise, but they succeeded in providing one of the better Season 2 experiences in recent memory. Returning from when where they left off, the action resumes quickly while resting only to provide more character backstories in a way that adds to the action and doesn't simply feel likefiller. They answered questions I wanted to know.


The story finally proceeds to an exciting, spectacular conclusion that will leave most fans feeling super satisfied, (I know I was) and then give you a cool down epilogue entry that is a bit tedious to sit through after the roller coaster you've just been on. I give this show (particularly this season) high marks across the board for story, art, sound, and voice acting. I voted the last season's Sub vs. Dub battle to the Dub, but it's so close again I'll give this one to the Sub. Both casts did an outstanding job.


This series in it's entirety serves as a worthy sequel to "Fate/Zero" and stands as one of the best Fantasy/Action shows ever made. I binged right through Season 2 after I finished Season 1 and it was well worth it. A must watch for any Anime fan. 9/10. Check it out.

Overall I enjoyed it and this route by Ufotable is one of my favorites. This route plays a much longer role to Deen's adaptation since Deen only released a movie and this is a series!

Have you seen S1? Yes? Good then let’s stop fucking around. Let me say that I’ve always sucked at reviewing successive season to shows, because in my mind, if you didn’t like the first season, why are you watching the sequel? Ask yourself that question whenever you’re in that position.
The Short Version:
(+)If you were a fan of S1, you’ll like this season as well.
(-)IF you don’t like small changes being made from the visual novel, you’re going to have a problem. 
The Story (7/10): Picking up right where the previous season left us, this season doesn’t exactly waste much time with kicking itself back intogear in the slightest. One of the things you might enjoy about this season over the first is that a little bit more backstory is given to the opponents than what was in S1. You come to understand them a bit better in terms of where they exactly stand and what their motivations are. 


This is one thing a lot of people ragged on about when this show was airing, because 1. HOW DARE THEY DIVERT FROM THE SOURCE MATERIAL?! and 2. They didn’t do the best job when it came to giving the characters some actual development past which Master had which Servant. As the little snippets we got felt very, very forced, but that’s one of the problems you’ll encounter when you adapt a single route of a visual novel that doesn’t have a singular absolute end.


Another thing worth mentioning in this season is the actually ending of the show, of which there are two depending on what suits your taste. Do you want the canonical? Or the ideal ending? Because they did a pretty good job of throwing both onto the screen, the former of which even manages to sneak in a little bit a character fanservice from Fate/Zero. One more point about this season is that it has what is undoubtedly one of the most brutal and unsettling deaths ever put to anime (That I know of).


The Characters (7/10): The characters are mostly the same as in S1, with some more backstory given to the opponents as mentioned before, that and the show has a rather major character twist that you might’ve figured out in S1 if you paid extra attention, if not, don’t worry they make it painfully obvious without telling you until a little later.


Art & Sound (8/10) & (8/10): Did you like the art in S1? It’s pretty much the same with a mild amount of skimping on the budget in some parts.


The sound is almost basically unchanged, although for the fans with sharp ears they’ll notice a track from the previous Fate entries that has wonderfully been remastered.


What do you think of this anime?


$260 Limited Edtion Blu-Ray Boxset. That should tell you.


Would you recommend this anime?


As long as you’ve watched S1, otherwise why the fuck are you starting with S2?


Goodbye my brethren, see you in the next one.
